pages.text: Hemicrinus astierianus hails from the Jurassic into the Early Cretaceous, with fossils found in formations across Spain, France and Poland. It is a relatively small and strange looking crinoid, with an elongated holdfast, short stem, and a crown at an effective 90 degree angle, giving a lot of its fossils a rather spoon-like appearance.
